result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher James Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent Deliver-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Faiure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or drugs.  No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision. 
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant:   that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher James Harris in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS 6 MONTHS with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court.  Defendant Christopher James Harris not in court  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for sentenceing, however defense requests more time.  Court order Stayed Bench Warrant cancelled.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher James Harris not in court.  Attorney Ann Bowe not in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was calendared for yesterday.  Defense attorney and defendant were not present.  Court GRANTS State request for imposed and stayed bench warrant.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 on 01/28/2016 at 8:30am.

At the courts request, and with consent of both parties, sentencing is moved from 01/26/2016 at 1:30am to 01/28/2016 at 8:30am.  Defendant is still required to check in with the court on 01/26/2016 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Christopher James Harris in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher James Harris in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher James Harris in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
This assignment is effective only as of 8/3/2015.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.

Defendant Christopher James Harris in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel still needs an offer and additional discovery.  Defense counsel wants to see if DNA has been tested.  Defendant needs to supply a bucco swab for DNA testing to be done.  Attorney Bowe to talk with client to see if he wants to provide a DNA sample after court today.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Substitution filed.  Case assigned to Judge Witkowiak, branch 22, in room 608 of the courthouse.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 8/7/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 22.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.   Court reminds defendant to not possess or use any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and   dangerous weapons.  aw
  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher James Harris in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher James Harris in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Danielle Chojnacki for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Stipulation to an adjournment for further investigation of this matter is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription, Oral  No Weapons Order  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.
